In my opinion the protagonist just understood that what she chose to do and who she chose to do it with was a choice all her own. He tried to respect that even though it hurt him to do that. So, the guy is okay in my book. The girl was clearly an airhead, so that didn't make matters any better cuz she couldn't tell that she was just being used. When she told him about all the stuff she'd been doing, that's when he tried to leave her behind. But you know, childhood friends and all that, he couldn't completely let her go. So, yea, I don't blame the guy in all this, but the girl though… She didn't have a thinking cap to put on. Lol!
